info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:17PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Otero County through 245 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mescalero. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mescalero and Soldier Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
